intro: Hibbertia striata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal regions. Hibbertia striata is a shrub that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, with hairy stems and elliptical leaves. Its flowers bloom in spring and are followed by red or orange berries that contain the seeds.
